intro: Aspidogyne zonata, commonly known as the zoned aspidogyne, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and elliptical leaves with a distinctive zonation pattern. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Aspidogyne zonata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along riverbanks.
